page.title: 20ALL SAINTS CHURCH ALLESLEY
page.content:
This church holds 350 and the nave measures 82 feet by 82 feet. There is a pipe organ with two manuals, a carved wooden pulpit, a brass lectern in the shape of an eagle and a carved stone altar.
The incumbent of All Saints is the Rev. Alan Burn B.A. He lives in the new rectory built in 1963. He has a deaconess and a part-time curate to help him. The population of the parish is approx. 7 500 and there are 280 names on the church's electoral roll.
There is a verger who looks after the church and two church wardens, one of whom has held this office for the past 25 years.
Sunday services are at: 08.00,11.00,18.30
